comments.commentBody: Any coach who still needs to be "developed" is not a suitable candidate to coach a national team.
Bill Simmons? This pretty much seals the deal. I'm skipping the entire NBA season. I'm not kidding.

I can't believe Simmons thinks Barkley is good.  He makes Tommy Heinsohn look like a MENSA member.  I think Bill Simmons should stick to Grantland.  He has very little charisma and it seems like he's having an inner dialogue with himself while he talks.  He's more edgy and has more to add in a less strict environment.  He shouldn't be worrying about having to set up Magic.  That's another guy who lacks intellectual acuity though his perspective, as a hall of famer is always interesting, and he's better than Charles.  I like it when guys who've just retired  do commentary.  The problem is that they get stale after a while. Tim Macarver, when he first started on TV was fantastic.  Now he stinks.  Kind of like all the people mentioned in this article.
Good first step. Now, get 'em both signed!

If the farm system doesn't have the next shortstop, first base, second base and center field ready, the Yankees are going to be stuck paying these guys.Maybe the Dodgers will trade for some of these guys.

After the way he hit in the ALCS, Swisher is a goner. Bad time to suck.

This is not true. The main changes will not require serious deterioration of lifestyle; rather just passing common sense laws that cause us to pay attention and be more careful; and to invest in new technologies. The Republicans and vested interests have sold climate change in the way you say, and have used their typical lies and aggressive tactics to mislead the public to a very considerable extent. They have made it into a politically controversial (but NOT scientifically controversial) topic.

Apparently the plutocrats, as well as Bain, do not understand that if all jobs are exported to China there will be no jobs left in America to buy the Chinese goods that are produced at lower wage costs. Lower income in this country means lower purchasing capacity by consumers. Their business logic is in the long run a self defeating strategy. American businesses eventually will crumble for lack of employed wage earning consumers.

The plutocrats don't worry that Americans won't have $ to buy goods made in China. They will sell their products in India. Or some other emerging market. Like China.

These "citizens of the world" have no loyalty to America. If they did, they would not have shipped our economy overseas.
This is the story that needs to be told in a TV ad.

The workers at the Bain-owned Sensata Company in Freeport, Illinois, who are tasked with training the Chinese workers who are about to take their jobs as Bain moves the company's production of automobile sensors to China, are waiting for Mitt Romney to "fight for every American job," or at least their own jobs. They have asked Romney to come to Freeport, but so far he has not responded. Why should he? In a prospectus from his company, Bain touted investments in China because of labor costs 85% lower than in the U.S.

Bain, of course, is only one vulture capitalist looking to profit from cheap labor in China. Outsourcing American jobs to foreign countries has been all too familiar in recent years. The rationale for it is cheaper production, which is supposed to translate to more affordable consumer goods. Sometimes it actually does, but the profit incentive is to take manufacturing to places of cheap labor, but keep the sales price just as high.

A case in point is the Vise-Grip Company of Dewitt, Nebraska, founded by a local blacksmith in the 1920s and eventually employing more than half of the town's 600 residents. Vise-Grip was sold to Rubbermaid, which closed the Dewitt factory in 2008 and now makes these handy locking pliers in China. (Chinese companies were already making knock-off copies of Vise-Grips that sold for little more than $2 in the U.S. compared to $12 for the genuine Vise-Grip.) The Chinese Vise-Grips still cost $12 at retail, minus U.S. quality.

I love the runners. I love the race. BUT, one day a year the race brings our City to a standstill. Why  paralyze our City that is already paralyzed from a natural disaster. It's a great mistake to have this race over troubled waters this time.
If they are hiring private security, they've got to have some extra money, no?

As a life long NYer, I can tell you, I feel insulted by all the runners who are coming here for their egos. Ok, so you will lose some money you paid if the race is cancelled, although most NYer have lost money. I own a small business and already lost more that you did in registration and training fees, and it's only 3 days so far. And NYers have lost homes, furniture, days at work, even lives (many were hit by trees) and maybe some who live here wouldn't be able to run the marathon themselves.

I'm glad you trained, then you are in good shape. If you want, you could run your own marathon in your own city on Sunday (I know, its not the "same" but none of our lives here in NY are the same.) I think anyone who talks about NYC's "resilience" is being self-serving; perhaps the potential runners could show some "resilience" and just wait til next year.

Cancel the race. It'll be an avoidable logistical burden on a population that is already stretched -- and will be more frayed by Sunday. The idea of asking people to put up with a parade when such services as hospitals have shut down due to a massive (and preventable) power outage is outrageous.

Running the marathon is bad taste and a slap o locals that are suffering in the aftermath of Sandy. I see no NY pride in it.  just stupidity. We need peace of mind right now. Not thousands of people descending on the city.
One word: ABSURD. Do the right thing...put people before money. Talking to you NYRR.
Please read "Tsunami" and nothing else! It is the tiny key board that messed that spelling!
Tsunamis have nothing to do with global warming.  They are caused by earthquakes.

Good Post, except that the earthquakes that caused the tsunamis in Japan, Indonesia (and also throughout the Indian Ocean in 2004) could hardly be blamed on Global Warming.

The Deniers will say; “See? Earthquakes do not happen due to Global Warming and try to destroy your argument based on that. Just saying.

2 storms within the space of 2 years causes massive damage to the northeast to the tune of tens maybe hundreds of billions of dollars, yet the right wing fanatics deny global warming. The greatest city on earth is brought to its knees with destruction and disruptions that I never thought  I would ever see, yet the same fanatics deny global warming. The great city of New Orleans is flooded with tens of billions of dollars in damages and thousand of lives lost, yet the right wing fanatics deny global warming. Japan is almost destroyed by earthquake with tsunamis never seen on this scale before yet they deny global warming. Indonesia is inundated with tsunamis on a scale never seen before, thousands perish yet they deny global warming. Texas and the southeast experience droughts on a scale never seen before yet they deny global  warmingThe scientists have predicted these are the types of events that global warming will precipitate for years. Many of these right wingers incredibly ascribe all these events to coincidence.  I say if you walk under a tall building 2 days in a row and a pail of water fall and hits you in the head on both days, there is no way it is coincidence.
Don't think so.  I have Flash and today the banner ads covered the forecast.  Now the ads are gone, guess they fixed it.
With Firefox on a PC no problem here, even with Flash disabled.
Nope-looks fine on my iPad.

For all of you who see an ad covering up the firecast, I am guessing that you do not have Adobe Flash installed, either because you're using a mobile device, or because you have chosen not to insall Flash.

I do not install Flash on my main computer because it's annoying and unnecessary and mainly used for delivering ad content. So, I cannot see the forecast on my main computer. However, when I switch to a compuer that has Flash installed, I can see the forecast: currently 78.4% for Obama.

I do not know why Flash is all of a sudden required to view the forecast but do find it inconvenient,
The ad isn't covering up the forecast. The forecast simply isn't included for today. I think it's safe to assume that this is deliberate and related to the turmoil in NYC.

if you look at http://delong.typepad.com/sdj/2012/10/give-us-the-daily-numbers-you-dork... it shows that the RAND sample was initially evenly divided in support for Obama and Romney. Over time this group moved towards Obama. The question is, why? One possibility is that any group that knows it will be polled every day will pay attention to the news more than a random sample of the population, and more information draws people to Obama. That's what I'd like to think, anyway.
Who does your now 12 year old nephew have this time?
I'm a subscriber and the data is covered by an ad for their web app which I also have.
Congress Works For Us, Grove is actually headed by Lisa Grove. I do know that one of David Axelrod's sons work for Huffington Post though. Just wanted to clarify misinformation.
Well, PC, I have no problems with the format or any other aspect of 538 using the iPad version of Safari.
That's not voter fraud, that's American politics. High office to the highest bidder.
ROTFL, yes, pleas check for voter fraud. As the Dems tend to vote early and often.
I hope the Obama campaign and dedicated journalists get in there and check out what you have said.

I am alerting the Obama campaign to the possibility of voter fraud in Iowa.   There is a lot of money being put in there on the "quiet".   Pundits wondered how the Des Moines Register endorsed a Repub after many many years.   It's because of the large amount of money going into Iowa.   The Democrats need to take a good look at the hisory of the new Secy of State Schulze.   Was he elected with LDS and Tea Party money with Karl Rove the architect for his election?   It sounds and looks too too handy.   Romny has been really quiet about Iowa.   Get in there Dems!!

If Nate wanted to perform an additional public service, it would be to examine the house effect of each pollster, and whether it changes closer to election day.  This would indicate less of a procedural issue with their polling, as he claims, and more of a 'thumb on the scale'.
Indeed ! The reason is there is no more Gallup poll in this RCP average due to Sandy. They will not publish a new one till sunday, just in time...

Agree.  In 2008, Gallup and Rasmussen did the same thing.  Very volatile and biased polling leading up to the election and as Election Tuesday drew near, their numbers came in line with the rest of American polling firms.  For most of the polling cycle, Rasmussen was very inaccurate.  My guess, it was an attempt to sway voters somehow or create an artificial landscape.  Intrade and 538 are the way to go.  Nate gives Romney a 21% chance of winning.  If I had a 21% chance of winning the lottery, I'd buy a ticket and at least start shopping for things in my mind.  Meaning, if the election is run 100 times, Romney wins 21 times.  He could win on the first roll.  Not likely, but very possible in the world of gambles.

Looks like the discrepancy between state and national is suddenly starting to diminish!

RCP national average is now a tie.

I'd watch for continued Obama uptick as Gallup/Rasmussen look to get their final numbers more in line with consensus in time for election day.
NY Times is still blocked in New Jersey? Down with Comrade Christie!

You have no idea what you are talking about. I'm an American expat that has been living in China for the past 3 1/2 years, and visiting here the past 13.

There are literally 10,000's of thousands of protests every year in China, far more than in the US.

As to enslaved labor, once again, you have no idea what you are talking about. People are free to come and go at their jobs. As to long hours, those factories that have been reducing hours under the pressure from their American customers are now facing disgruntled workers who can't understand why they are being punished as they want to work as much as they can to make as much as they can over a short period of time. These young workers are out to work hard, save their money to better their lives, while at the same time sending money home to support their families. These are not careers but stints of typically 2 to 3 years.

As to dormitory cramped living, again, this is a cultural thing of which you also have no clue. These same conditions exist at boarding high schools and universities. It is what the Chinese do and are used to. There is nothing unusual about it. it is the norm.

Chinese workers are far from enslaved and they are in fact a quite mobile workforce. They will switch companies or locations readily for even a small amount of additional pay.

Factory workers tend to live in dormitories because that is a perk offered to attract workers. If you do not provide accomodations, they probably will not work for you. Factory workers are largely migrant labor working away from home and have no interest in springing for an apartment out of their own pocket.

Their objective in being away from home is to earn as much as possible, and spend as little as possible. They want overtime - as much as possible. If you start cutting back the opportunity for overtime they will leave.

I think rather than them working under constant threat of being replaced, it is the employer that is constantly afraid they will leave.

China has out stripped the US (with our help) in producing an enslaved worker class that has few rights, excessive work hours, dormitory cramped living conditions and who live under constant threat of losing their jobs to admit a ready replacement.

They have no voice and are oppressed by the government and management alike.

There is no democracy, no free speech and dissenters are dealt with summarily.

We are going that direction ourselves (student loan lifetime indentured servitude travesty in particular) but we are as yet no where near as bad as the Chinese.

Of course they're leaving, if they can think they are bound to leave.
